mdRecord.dcterms:title: Oak Alley Plantation, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Pilie, Gilbert Joseph (American architect, contemporary) [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The mansion on the plantation was built by George Swainy between 1837 and 1839 for Jacques Telesphore Roman. Jacques' father-in-law, Joseph Pilie, was an architect and is considered the likely designer. The mansion has a square floor plan, organized around a central hall that runs from the front to the rear on both floors. The outside features a free-standing colonnade of 28 Doric columns on all four sides, a common feature among the mansions in the Mississippi Valley at the time. -- en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oak_Alley_Plantation [work]
